title: 旧约 - 诗篇(Psalms) - 第 137 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 诗篇(Psalms) -- 第 137 章 ( 本篇共有 150 章 )

lineList.en: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
lineList.cn: 他们曾在巴比伦的河边坐下，一追想锡安就哭了。

lineList.en: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
lineList.cn: 我们把琴挂在那里的柳树上。

lineList.en: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
lineList.cn: 因为在那里，掳掠我们的要我们唱歌，抢夺我们的，要我们作乐，说，给我们唱一首锡安歌吧。

lineList.en: How shall we sing the LORD's song in a strange land?
lineList.cn: 我们怎能在外邦唱耶和华的歌呢。

lineList.en: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.
lineList.cn: 耶路撒冷阿，我若忘记你，情愿我的右手忘记技巧。

lineList.en: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
lineList.cn: 我若不记念你，若不看耶路撒冷过于我所最喜乐的，情愿我的舌头贴于上膛。

lineList.en: Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.
lineList.cn: 耶路撒冷遭难的日子，以东人说，拆毁，拆毁，直拆到根基。耶和华阿求你记念这仇。

lineList.en: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.
lineList.cn: 将要被灭的巴比伦城阿（城原文是女子），报复你像你待我们的，那人便为有福。

lineList.en: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
lineList.cn: 拿你的婴孩摔在磐石上的，那人便为有福。
